text:
personal opinion — any chance you get to remove legacy code/css, take it. I’d pretend that the css file was gone and ask for more time to get this completed.

If there are complicated items, you can always use developer tools to inspect and give guidance, but I think redoing it will always result in better work. All of my work from 3 weeks ago is terrible, so I will always improve upon it
Hi. I am developing a custom HubSpot CMS theme from scratch.  I am trying to add an option to change my header colour (light or dark) on a page by page basis. Any idea how to do this?
yes, you should be able to query your hubdb table for the selection you are looking for
are you setting this in the code, or on the page level ?

you can do this with a local module, by updating each module on each page with a color

or you could set this in a global module, add a repeater, to it, and then have a few fields for color seelction, page url, etc so that you check for those that match your current page and force the header color

So I started by setting my header a regular module, but then realised I will have to build my main navigation for each page. Ideally I want to have a global module and be able to change a dark/light option per page.
I kind of get the global module concept you are suggesting. Will look into this further but hoping that there was an easier solution.
does the user need to be able to change for each page ?
yeah, ideally as the header is fixed, transparent and may be sitting on top of a light or dark hero/intro section.
so….

If I was implementing this, I would create a switch on the hero / intro module for “change header” wiht the choices you have, and use javascript to change add a class to the header, and that css class would then change the header to be what you need it to be
yes that was a last attempt consideration as you would get a flash of styling, or hide header/nav until page loaded.

or do this
probs not the best idea :laughing:
not sure how your templates are set up

Maybe a template level choice field?
`{% choice "navigation_color" label='Light or Dark Navigation?',  value='Dark', choices='Light, Dark' export_to_template_context=True %}`  anywhere within your base.html or template that needs the feature.
you could do that
if you have your templates set up as like a flex column, you could create a template with a body class that changes your header colors
and you could pull it into your menu, header, body, etc with `{{ ' has-{{ widget_data.navigation_color.value | lower }}-navigation' if widget_data.navigation_color.value }}`
and thne the user just needs to chagne templates based upon how they will set it up
lol i’ve never tried bringing in a widget data value into a module
does that work?
ok, thanks very much both of you. I have some options to investigate further. :thumbsup::thumbsup:
If you plug in like a text, choice, etc, one of those basic HubSpot module/fields you can export whatever it generates anywhere - doesnt have to be directly from a module
it's like a dedicated module field but for a template
once it's in there, and not assigned to a location it displays at the top of the tpl
I use to add a field to the header or a module that would generate similar hooks but it was unreliable sometimes.
Thanks for the info. Got it working with a regular module, changed my header module to global, now it can't access my widget data. very strange
think it's an ordering issue, need to define options further up the dom
